description: The Burkinabe government has ordered the closing of pre-schools, primary, post-primary and secondary, vocational and university educational establishments from March 16 March 31 throughout the national territory.

description: The extension by two weeks of the closure of pre-school, primary, post-primary, secondary, vocational and university educational establishments throughout the national territory. The resumption date is set for 14 April 2020, but could be adjusted according to the evolution of the epidemic. UPDATE: The original closure of educational institutions was set to last until March 31; it has been extended to April 14.

description: Starting on March 21st at midnight, Burkinabe government has implemented the establishment of a curfew from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am throughout the nation.
The Burkinabe Council declared a state of health alert in accordance with Article 66 of the Public Health Code.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The Burkinabe president announced the closure of the Ouagadougou and Bob-Dioulasso airports to commercial flight for a period of 2 weeks, renewable, from March 21 at midnight; this measure does not apply to domestic and military flights and cargo.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Burkinabe government announced the closure of all land and rail borders, for a period of two weeks, renewable, starting at midnight on 21 March 2020, except for freight.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Burkina Faso's Ministry of Industry, Trade and Handicrafts has set maximum prices for hydroalcoholic gels and solutions and respiratory protection masks in Burkina Faso, to be fixed for a period of 6 months from March 25, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Burkinabe Ministry in charge of Research announced on March 26, the launch of two clinical trials of Chloroquine-Azitromycin and Apivirine, a drug produced in Benin and used in the treatment of HIV-AIDS, will also be tested.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Burkina Faso's government issued a decree to lockdown for a period of 2 weeks, starting from March 27, 2020 at 7 a.m., all cities or localities having registered a positive case of COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
target_city: Ouagadougou; Bobo-dioulasso; Boromo; Dédougou; Houndé; Banfora; Manga; Zorgho
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: As of the 30th of March, the city of Dano (Burkina Faso) is placed under lockdown after confirmation of a case of COVID-19.
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country

description: The Burkinabe Department of Justice announced the suspension of visits to inmates but has authorized the presence of their lawyers from March 19, 2020, until further notice.

description: The National Identification Office (ONI) announced the suspension of special operations of identification document establishments, to comply with the Government's measure prohibiting any groupings of more than 50 persons. UPDATE: The National Identification Office of Burkina Faso announced its offices' closures
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: Burkina Faso issued the immediate suspension of biometric enrolment operations and the suspension of special operations for the issuance of Burkina Faso national identity cards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description: Burkinabe authorities ban demonstrations and public gatherings until at least April 30 due to ongoing COVID-19 outbreak.
On March 20th, the Burkinabe president announced a ban on any groupings of more than 50 people.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Demonstrations and/or gatherings of people in places and/or venues open to the public have been banned in the Centre region, including the organization of baptisms, weddings (official, religious, traditional) and any other event involving the public from March 25 to April 20, 2020.
The wearing of masks or nose-masks will be mandatory from 27 April 2020, throughout the national territory in Burkina Faso.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police
